title: Diploma in Sales and Distribution Management
headline: Learn about the factors influencing sales force and the management of distribution channels in this free online course.
description: This free online course on sales and distribution management will be particularly useful for companies, managers and business executives who deal with customer sales, sales channels as well as sales personnel management. By the end of this course, you will become more familiar with the factors influencing the optimal design and management of distribution channels, as well channel designs for improving efficiency in sales force management.
courseDescription:
This free online course in sales and distribution management will begin by introducing you to the meaning of sales management and the evolution of sales management as a function. You will learn about the importance of sales management for marketing functions and for the organization as a whole. You will also be introduced to the relationship between sales management, personalized selling and salesmanship, as well as the differences between selling and marketing.

The course then explains some important marketing policies, and their relevance in an organization. You will learn about the meaning and purpose of a sales organization. You will also learn about inter - departmental relationships and its relevance in fostering a high performing sales force team in any sales organization. Next, you will be introduced to the human resources aspect of sales force management.

The course then explains the meaning of sales quota, rationale behind a sales quota, and why sales organizations sets up sales quotas. You will also learn about the types of sales quotas, and the various methods used for setting and administering a good quota system. This course explains in great detail the meaning of a sales territory, rationale behind formation of sales territories, and the procedure for setting up or revising sales territories. You will learn about distribution channels, the functions and relevance of distribution channel flows to the sustainability of the overall sales management force across the world.

Start Course Now

  • Lesson Summary
    • Production concept means that in order to succeed, it is important that businesses must produce mass scale, distribute mass scale, they would achieve economies of scale
    • In the first half of the 20th century, the focus shifted from product and production to the selling concept, where again the seller remained the king
    • Specific duties and responsibilities of a sales manager include: determining the sales and objectives of the sales force, organizing sales force, sales forecasting and budgeting, sales force management 
    • Sales department is the only department that is instrumental to revenue generation 
    • The financial result of a firm depends on the performance of sales department 
    • Top management expectations include: achieving sales target, profit contributions, maintain continuous business path 
    • Personal selling involves face to face interaction between sellers and prospects, including informing and persuading the latter to enter into a transaction 
    • Sales management administers the personal selling effort, and personal selling is enacted through salesmanship
    • Selling is the transaction between the seller and the prospective buyer
    • Types of sales jobs include: retail, direct, wholesaler, manufacturer
  • Learning Outcomes

    • Explain the relevance of sales related policies for sales personnel 
    • List the types of sales related policies 
    • Describe the basics of sales related marketing policies 
    • Describe the meaning of sales pricing policies 
    • Describe the concept of strategic planning 
    • Discuss strategic business unit in strategic planning 
    • Explain the role of marketing in organizational planning 
    • Explain sales objectives, strategies and tactics 
    • Explain the meaning and purpose of a sales organization

  • Lesson Summary
    • Salesperson should get knowledge of selling and sales related marketing policies 
    • It is the responsibility of the sales executives  to administer policies that are shaped by the managers 
    • The relevance of sales marketing policies for sales personnel emerges from the fact that it impacts their function as well as the overall sales department
    • Sales policies act as directives for the sales staff with respect to planning and achievement of the overall sales objectives of the company
    • Sales related policies include: product, distribution and pricing 
    • Products determine the basic nature of a company. Product related policies are those policies which involves decisions regarding the products of the company
    • Types of product related policies include: product line, product design, product quality and service policy
    • A company in order to survive cannot ignore competitor's pricing policy. In case of price based competition, companies often price product at the same price as that of competition 
    • Strategic planning can be defined as an organizational process which helps to define an organization's long term objectives and subsequent strategies 
    • Corporate planning is usually developed at the. headquarters of a company, and the objective is drive and guide the entire organization

    • List the four entities that maintains contact with the sales department in an organization

    • Define sales planning 
    • Discuss the characteristics of a good sales plan 
    • Explain the meaning of sales forecast 
    • Explain the use of sales forecast by other departments in a sales organization 
    • List the different types of sales forecast

  • Lesson Summary
    • The sales department occupies a place of immense importance in an organization owing to its revenue generation nature 
    • Manufacturing good products is not a stand alone function. It involves a huge coordination between other departments like finance, human resource management and others 
    • Heads of departments are required to not only achieve their targets but also harmonize their departmental activities with other departments to achieve overall organizational objectives
    • Technical information provided by the production and operations departments help sales people in understanding the product, making sales presentations and closing the sales 
    • The HR department specializes in activities like job analysis, recruiting, selecting and motivation 
    • One of the key functions of sales management is planning. It involves making decisions about long term sales objectives of the company 
    • Sales planning is an effective method that involves activities like sales forecasting, demand management and determining sales target keeping in mind the desired level of profitability by an organization 
    • A sales forecast helps formulate plans for production in the case of manufacturing and production departments. it also helps assess the adequacy of production capacity of a firm 
    • Market potential is the minimum sales or the best possible sales which the companies in an industry can ear for a given product or service in a distinct period of time
    • Market forecast depicts the anticipated industry sales for a given product or service in a defined span of time in a given market at the specified marketing expenditure 
  • Learning Outcomes

    • Explain the meaning of buyer - seller dyads
    • Describe the model of the salesperson - buyer dyadic relationships 
    • Discuss the diversity of personal - selling situations 
    • Differentiate between developmental and service selling 
    • List the types of sales position 
    • Describe the categorization of sales position 
    • Explain the concept and theories of selling 
    • Describe the AIDAS theory of selling 
    • Explain the right set of circumstances for for selling 
    • Discuss the behavioural equation theory 
    • Explain the concept of SPIN selling

  • Lesson Summary
    • Understanding salesmanship requires an examination of how buyers and sellers interact with one another 
    • A major determinant of buyer - seller dyadic interactions is the buyer's conditioning with respect to making purchase decisions 
    • Developmental selling involves creating new customers, increasing market share and profits for a company 
    • Missionary salespersons are sales people whose job is to educate prospective buyers or users about products and services
    • Technical salespersons are sales people who have technical skills as well as sales skills 
    • The theories of selling include: seller oriented, buyer oriented, buyer and seller oriented 
    • Buying behaviour is explained as a purchase decision process and as a phase of learning 
    • The fore elements of the learning process are drives, cues, response and reinforcement 
    • The concept of SPIN selling was proposed by Neil Rackham, former president and founder of Huthwaite corporation 
    • A successful sales call is one where the buyers talk more and this implies the salespeople are the ones asking the questions. The asking of questions implies a rapport building 
    • Sales people follow a sequence of process while making a sale
